name: 2-(trifluoromethyl)benzonitrile
Reason: 2-(trifluoromethyl)benzonitrile has a basic unit of benzonitrile, which has a melting point around -13°C. The presence of a trifluoromethyl group increases the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight, electronegativity, and the potential for hydrogen bonding. Each fluorine atom can add approximately +10°C to the melting point. The trifluoromethyl group has three fluorine atoms, which can add approximately +30°C to the melting point.
